description: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.
author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
name: Renamed AdFind Execution
query: (((process.command_line.text:("*domainlist*" OR "*trustdmp*" OR "*dcmodes*" OR "*adinfo*" OR "*\ dclist\ *" OR "*computer_pwdnotreqd*" OR "*objectcategory\=*" OR "*\-subnets\ \-f*" OR "*name\=\"Domain\ Admins\"*" OR "*\-sc\ u\:*" OR "*domainncs*" OR "*dompol*" OR "*\ oudmp\ *" OR "*subnetdmp*" OR "*gpodmp*" OR "*fspdmp*" OR "*users_noexpire*" OR "*computers_active*" OR "*computers_pwdnotreqd*")) OR (winlog.event_data.Imphash:("bca5675746d13a1f246e2da3c2217492" OR "53e117a96057eaf19c41380d0e87f1c2")) OR (winlog.event_data.Hashes:(*IMPHASH\=BCA5675746D13A1F246E2DA3C2217492* OR *IMPHASH\=53E117A96057EAF19C41380D0E87F1C2*)) OR (winlog.event_data.OriginalFileName:"AdFind.exe")) AND (NOT process.executable.text:"*\\AdFind.exe"))
